title: Drawing, The Triumph of Venus designed for the bedroom of Palazzo Milzetti, Faenza, 1802
title_raw: The Triumph of Venus designed for the bedroom of Palazzo Milzetti, Faenza
medium: Pen and ink on paper; wm lines.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Vertical rectangle, with beveled upper corners. Vertical oval: flying Hours carry the goddess who takes something from tray. Verso: part of plan of room (in pencil), with windows and doors indicated. Written twice, with pen: "Finestra" and three times: "Porta."

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, The Triumph of Venus designed for the bedroom of Palazzo Milzetti, Faenza, 1802. Pen and ink on paper; wm lines.. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3312
